Child 'scientist' says vaccines DO cause autism - and brilliantly explains the 'evidence'

  • 14:52, 31 May 2016
  • Updated 14:53, 31 May 2016
  • By Kara O'Neill

Marco Arturo even put together a big folder which he claimed contained 'a tonne' of medical evidence

  •   Share
  •   Comments

Get daily news by email

The video will start in 8s Cancel

Watch Next

    Click to play Tap to play
    The Live Event you are trying to watch is either unavailable or has not started Please refresh this page in your browser to reload this live event video

    This is the brilliant moment a junior scientist claims vaccines cause autism - then lays out his evidence in the BEST way.

    Marco Arturo posted the video on his Facebook page on May 24 and it has already clocked up more than 3.2 million views .

    Wearing glasses and a blue polo shirt, the 12-year-old then looks straight at the camera and prepares to explain his argument.

    Marco says: "We've all been lied to by doctors and pharmaceutical companies about vaccines.

    After a lot of research I realised that vaccines do and will cause autism."

    Marco, who lives with his family in Mexico, then presents a folder which he claims contains every single piece of evidence that proves vaccines cause autism.

    But when he opens up the folder, all the pages are completely blank.

    Read more: Children should play in dirt to stop them getting IBS

    Hilariously, at the end of the footage, Marco reveals one piece of paper with the word 'mic' scrawled across it, which he drops to make his final point.

    Poll loading …
